qas.question: Who was elected to be the head of government in 2006?
Why did the first elected head of government of Mexico City resign?

answers.text: to run in the 2000 presidential elections

qas.question: Who was the second head of government elected?
Who was head of government after the first elected head of government?
Who was the first woman to run Mexico City?

context: The first elected head of government was Cuauhtémoc Cárdenas. Cárdenas resigned in 1999 <a1_0>to run in the 2000 presidential elections<a1_0/> and designated <a3_0><a4_0>Rosario Robles<a4_0/><a3_0/> to succeed him, who became the first woman (elected or otherwise) to govern Mexico City. In 2000 <a2_0>Andrés Manuel López Obrador<a2_0/> was elected, and resigned in 2005 to run in the 2006 presidential elections, Alejandro Encinas being designated by the Legislative Assembly to finish the term. In 2006, <a0_0>Marcelo Ebrard<a0_0/> was elected for the 2006–2012 period.
